dialogues.text: I hope I didn't hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At any rate, Dad wanted to hire a private detective to ferret you out, and I said, "What for?" Whatever the hell he's doing, even if it's a completely wasteful escapade, it's entirely his business. Simple as that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I really appreciate it, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you should infer Daddy was wrong in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Spicer, pushing a spoon at Nicholas's closed mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't force him like that, Spicer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer lays the spoon down and begins eating his own dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Catherine) How long have you been staying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to ask another question and is again overridden by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear about my misfortune, Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still nearly impossible for me to turn my neck. If I wanted to turn toward Catherine, for instance, I'd first have to twist the whole base of my body around... (demonstrating) ... like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita gets up from the table and, taking her plate, exits to the kitchen. And as Carl readjusts himself in his chair and takes a sip from his wine glass, Bobby looks at Catherine to find her looking at him. She quickly alters her gaze to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mind doing a little work, if you're finished, and not too tired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm finished... (placing a hand on his stomach) Satiety is my father and mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding he's amused himself and nobody else, he gets up and addresses Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tremendously gifted, this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her) Is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine stands up and, wanting to change the subject:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I don't want to hear this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits and Carl, on his way out, pauses at Bobby's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you feel at home, Robert. (patting him on the shoulder) I'm really glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Carl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down table to see Spicer stacking his plate onto Nicholas's and his eyes follow him as he, too, moves out of the dining room to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in extreme discomfort at being left alone with his father. He looks down at his plate, poking at the remainder of his dinner, then braves a look down the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking back at him, his eyes devoid of interest or cognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Tita walk away from the house down toward the ocean. Accompanying them is a Borzoi hound belonging to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has ways of communicating, Robert. I can tell when he's expressing approval or disapproval, just from his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm hmm. Some range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. I can't take seeing him, sitting there like a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week or two isn't going to ruin your life, for Godsakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you think I'm that happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. (a pause, then:) You should've left a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't all get up and leave, can we? I mean, there are certain needs you have to respond to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops walking and moves to one of the garden chairs, facing out toward the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anyway, I want you to stay, so I can spend some time with you, and ask you some questions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans his back against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you -- I mean, have you enjoyed all these... strange things you've been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him for a moment, and taking note of it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Am I some kind of freak to you or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I don't think that, I'm just curious about it... (a pause) Do you think I'm a freak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Why? What is it? The way I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't really think you're a freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably am, but I don't care. I mean, I wasn't that blessed to begin with, and when would I have had time to make any improvements...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Carl and Catherine? Is he just coaching her, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constantly. Night and day. And unless I get up before the birds, I can't get in any practice time for myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's very admirable, the way she works. She'll probably be enormously successful, because she's attractive as well, not that that's so important in music, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're attractive, Tita. If you just did a little more with yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you just maybe did something with your hair, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let's not talk about my hair, it does what it wants to, and anyway, who cares, I want to talk about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to say, Tita...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers nothing further and looks out over the bay. Then, after a brief silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not going to run out on me right away, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby strolls casually about the house - in truth, looking for an opportunity to run into Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the music room and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine can be seen, seated at the piano. Carl stands above her and they engage in some exchange about the score resting on the piano's music stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he moves down the hallway and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer descending the staircase, with the brittle Nicholas in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks into the nearest room to avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita, startled in the act of appraising herself in a mirror above the fireplace, turns around to Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, don't sneak up on me like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see she wears a little make-up and has done something "different" with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and exits the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands on the front porch, looking toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Catherine coming up from the ocean. She wears a bathrobe over a wet bathing suit and carries a towel, and as she approaches:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you fell in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Yes, intentionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's dangerous, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swimming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing piano all day and then jumping into cold water. You could get a cramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and begins drying her hair with a corner of the towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love to swim, and I don't mind the cold at all. It's invigorating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't want to get too invigorated myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I do with it? Run amok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides piano and swimming, what else do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's fishing and boating. There's concerts on the mainland and... but I feel silly telling you. This is really your home. You probably know better than I what there is to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? Then it must be very boring for you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Have you anything to suggest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Let me give it some thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward the front door, with Bobby following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine comes inside and moves toward the stairway, with Bobby behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now I'm going to run a hot tub and soak myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes up a few steps and turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that, I plan to read some music and rest for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's a full practice day... (continues up the stairs) But the day after is kind of open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, she stops and looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has hydrotherapy on Tuesdays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if it were a year) The day after tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll probably be free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and disappears into the second-floor hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner has concluded and Tita moves around the table, distributing cups and saucers. Carl is remote and off his feed. Spicer attends Nicholas, and Catherine looks across the table to Bobby as he drinks from a bottle of beer. After a moment, a loud belch comes from Nicholas and Tita quickly requests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She attempts to stifle her own amusement, as do Bobby and Catherine, then changes the subject:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Carl, you hardly ate anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took some aspirin and it really upset my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine begins pouring the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing that's hard to understand is how you could have this incredible background in music, and then just walk away from it, without a second thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave it a second thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita seats herself at the table, addressing Spicer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks tired to me, Spicer. I think you should put him to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, and as he gets up and wheels Nicholas from the room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, how could you not play anymore? That's so strange to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have played a few times. Here and there. As a matter of fact, I was once a rehearsal pianist for a Las Vegas musical revue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't call that music, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. It's music. You know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places his hands on the table and simulates the playing of a rousing production-type show-stopper, simultaneously vocalizing as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though Tita and Catherine are amused, Carl winces disapprovingly and breaks into Bobby's act:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Will you excuse us for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes hold of Catherine's hand and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really don't have to, Carl, if you're not feeling good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit martyred) Well, maybe if we put the Thermaphore on me for a while, first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they move to the door, she glances apologetically back at Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deflated and embarrassed, he looks away from Tita's sympathetic gaze. After a brief silence, she reaches to a platter on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some gingerbread?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elsewhere) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With applesauce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands in the living room. It is dark and the only light comes from some burning logs in the fireplace. He listens briefly to the sounds of a Beethoven sonata coming from the music room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then moves to a chaise near the fireplace and lies down, staring absently into the flames. After a moment, he closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on his sleeping face as the sonata begins to FADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still asleep in the chaise. He is suddenly jolted awake by a loud thud and sits up, looking out the window to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lifting a barbell with heavy weights attached to it. He does a series of vigorous presses with it, before he again lets the bar drop heavily onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BACH VIOLIN OVER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands in the hallway, a phone to his ear, listening to Rayette and looking down the hall toward the open door to Catherine's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well fine, you know what I suggest, Ray... (listening) Because I don't know how long. Things are not going that well here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens again, his eyes on Catberine, moving around in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I'm not having any fun, either, so why don't you... (pause) No, you can't, it's just not convenient, and I have to get off... (listening impatiently) Ray, I really have to go, I have to get off now... (longer pause) Another couple of days, maybe. I'll call you and let you -- (pause) All right, if you're gone, you're gone. Now I have to get off, okay? (pause) Bye, Ray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and, as he starts down the hall to Catherine's room, the VIOLIN STOPS and Carl steps out into the hall ahead of him. He carries his fiddle and detains Bobby, with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only 10 minutes of playing and it's already killing my neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks past him to Catherine as she glances out at them and then closes the door to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Carl, playing a game of table tennis. Tita stands leaning against a tree, watching them. In the b.g., Spicer can be seen, meticulously oiling and cleaning the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they volley the ball back and forth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you should be playing, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Aside from my neck, I'm in superb shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hits into the net, and as the ball rebounds to him, he tosses it to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serving) I don't know, there's something wrong with the way you move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hits the net again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not aware of it. Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your serve. Two -- Eighteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl serves and as they volley:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hate to see you walk across a concert stage like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl tries a smash and mis-hits the ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two -- Nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and as he retrieves it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated with Bobby) I've walked across a stage a number of times, without exciting any particular response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl comes back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any particular humor, I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He angrily serves the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning) I think you should get someone to coach you how to walk. I think it's a substantial problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits a smash and it sails past Carl into some shrubbery several yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves after the ball, Bobby gestures at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. He does walk funny. Don't you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Carl, bent over and searching through the shrubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'd notice. I'm so used to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wanting to go on about it) Yeah, well, he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She interrupts him, looking toward Spicer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? Do you think Spicer is attractive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Spicer, polishing the frame of the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's got a terrific personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, he was formerly a sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gestures his paddle at Carl, on his way back with the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can't you see that, what I'm talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailors are sadistic, I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl comes up to the table, asserting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? There's nothing wrong with the way I walk. Now where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At game, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl serves and they volley briefly. Then BobbY angles the ball sharply and puts it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's three games to none, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's have a rematch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had to go to the mainland today. Aren't you going to miss the ferry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes a quick glance at his watch, then drops his paddle onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. Just when I was hitting my stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away, then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye to Catherine for me, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves off in the direction of the cars, Tita comes up beside Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I play now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl calls over to them from his car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'll be back sometime tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby turns to Tita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the question) My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the paddle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you and Spicer play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and moves off toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby knocks on Catherine's door and, hearing no response, opens it and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders about, discreetly touching nothing, but taking in some essence of Catherine from her belongings and from the scent of her that lingers in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His journey brings him into proximity with the windows and he pauses to look out at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: playing table tennis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to move from the windows, when he sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulling into view and parking near the garage. She gets out, and, carrying a shopping bag and a wrapped bouquet of flowers, pauses on her way to the house to have some exchange with Tita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: quickly descending the staircase, and FOLLOWING with him as he moves to the music room and goes inside, leaving the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to one of the grands, seats himself and rubs his hands together to warm them. Then, scanning his mental repertoire, he places his hands on the keyboard and begins to play a Chopin etude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Presently, Catherine appears in the doorway. She stands listening for a moment, then places the shopping bag and flowers on a settee near the doorway and crosses to a chair near the pianos and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby glances at her, then returns his eyes to the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her features intensely concentrated, as she listens to his playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: apparently deep into the music. On the wall behind him are the series of photographs seen in the opening and the present ANGLE FAVORS an 8-year-old Bobby in his dress suit, playing a recital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES down to his hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then to Catherine, profoundly moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bobby plays the concluding chords of the etude. He lets his hands linger on the keys until the last overtones fade, then he removes them to his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a brief silence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was beautiful, Robert. I'm surprised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was really very moved by the way you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to keep up the "serious" musician pose, a brief, derisive laugh issues from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't supposed to be, it just struck me that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just that... I picked the easiest piece I could remember. I think I first played it when I was 8 years old and I played it better then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. It was the feeling I was affected by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no inner feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I must have been supplying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and crosses toward the settee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least you're accomplished at something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At being a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she picks up the flowers and the shopping bag:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're very good at it. I'm really impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks down at the keyboard. He closes the cover and softly utters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands in front of a dresser mirror, pinning up her hair, preparatory to taking a bath. Her attention is drawn to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bobby entering, and as he crosses to her, she quickly turns back to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't what I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... You made a very calculated move, and then made me feel embarrassed for responding to you. That wasn't necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves away from him and he follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it was. You've made it clear that if I can cut a little piano, I might get a little response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops and turns to him) I don't think that's accurate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to now, what I've been getting from you are meaningful looks over the dinner table and a lot of vague suggestions about the day after tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not conscious of having given you any meaningful looks. And as for the day after tomorrow, this is the day after tomorrow, and I am, unfortunately, seeing you... Now if you'll excuse me, I'd like to take a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves back to the dresser and as she begins searching through an array of bath oils on top of it, Bobby steps in beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's convenient to fake looking for something right now, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not faking anything. I'm looking for some bath oil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some bath oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts up one of the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this one? (picking up another) Or this one? (and another) How about some jasmine? (and another) What about some musk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking the bottles over) What are you doing, screwing around with this crap?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little intimidated by his aggressivity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't find your language that charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's direct, anyway, which seems to be difficult for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to leave now. Is that direct enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes no move to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a serious person, by your own admission. And that may be interesting, but it doesn't interest me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needing the safety of distance, she moves over to the windows next to the bed. Again, he follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious, that's what's important to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's what's important to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her by the shoulders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's be serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and forces her onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates for a moment, full of things he wants to say and cannot. Catherine looks up at him, uttering a quiet challenge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No inner feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe vou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans down to her, begins kissing her. Her arms encircle him and laying back on the bed, she pulls his body onto hers, fervently returning his kisses. And as he responds with an ardor absent of fakery and full of a lifetime of derelict feelings, a FADE OVER BEGINS, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Bobby lie side by side. He watches her as she addresses the ceiling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I married him when I was 17. He was a cellist, and I thought he was the most brilliant man I'd ever met... And I'm sure he was, because at that age, I hadn't met that many... But he was insidious, you know. He had me convinced that I was a mediocrity, musically, as a woman, as an intellect. But in this completely imperceptible, pleasant way, so that you weren't even sure he was doing it. Anyway, I just woke up one morning and I said, you know something Joseph, you're full of beans, and I left him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something witty and devastating like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves onto her side, looking over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, he's the one who introduced me to Carl... (a pause, then:) How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl restored my confidence. He really did. He's much more substantial than you give him credit for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over, tentatively caressing his face, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could discreetly move across the hall now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, gets up and crosses to the door, and as he opens it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could spend some time with you tomorrow morning, before Carl comes back, I mean, if you'd like to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'd like to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CHOPIN OVER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Catherine walk over a path through a thickly wooded area that presently brings them in sight of the Dupea house. He stops and, taking hold of her, leans back against a tree, kissing her. When they break off and resume walking, she takes one of his hands in both of hers and, after looking at the scars and callouses accumulated by his years of manual labor, she lays the hand against her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANGLE ALTERS from them, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxicab pulls up in front of the house. Rayette gets out with her suitcase and, after paying the driver, moves up the steps to the front door and reaches out to ring the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking down the table to Nicholas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly do have a beautiful piece a real estate out here, Mr. Dupea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the former with his chin resting on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Bobby) Can he hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) He's not hard of hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a blessing, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a bite of food, and as she chews:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This certainly is an improvement on the motel an' the coffee shop. (to Bobby) How could you have left such a beautiful place, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fascinated with Rayette, while beside him, Catherine keeps her eyes on her plate as she eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been staying in a motel all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For two whole weeks, an' there wasn't hardly nobody there to talk to but me. The manager of the place told me it was the off season, an' it must a ben, because other'n me, there was just this 25-year-old kid, DeLyon, that didn't appear to be all there, an' this old married pair next to me that was always hollerin' for quiet. Can you imagine? All you could a heard there was a pin, an' them, hollerin' away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you had to stay in a motel. There's more than enough room here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was goin' to, but Bobby said he hadda kind of feel things up here first, which I can understand, but then it went an' took so long, I ran flat outa money... (to Bobby) I didn't have no number to call, you know. (to Carl) So I hadda clear outa there an' come on up here, in the hopes that I wouldn't be intrudin' myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You're more than welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, that's a very nice thing for you to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes on eating and there is a brief silence before she resumes, looking over at Catherine:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That certainly is a beautiful head a hair you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it natural?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just finish eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, am I holdin' up dessert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. Go ahead and take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do eat slow as a bird, whereas Bobby can put it away like a speed swing... (to Tita) Is there any ketchup around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for chrissakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, let's not be rude, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. He don't mean anything by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws his napkin on the table, gets up and leaves the room. There is an awkward silence, followed by Rayette valiantly covering her own feelings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Bobby's just about the moodiest man I ever ben with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TAMMY WYNETTE'S "DON'T TOUCH ME" OVER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby finishes the last of several drinks. He ships a half pint into his jacket pocket, lays some bills on the bar and moves toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WYNETTE OVER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thoroughly anesthetized, he wanders aimlessly through the harbor-front streets. As he disappears into the dark, the MUSIC FADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lying huddled on the boardwalk next to the boat slips. The crying of the gulls and the sound of outgoing fishing launches awaken him. Disoriented, he gets to his feet and, hugging himself against the cold, moves unsteadily down the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's car pulls off the ferry and approaches a line of cars waiting to board. He sees Catherine at the wheel of the first car, and pulling abreast of her, stops and rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to pick up some friends of Carl's. Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blocked cars behind each of them begin HONKING impatiently and CONTINUE TO under the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to talk to you now. I have to explain something about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't have to, it isn't necessary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping her) Yes, it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRIVER behind Bobby sticks his bead out the window, yelling furiously at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get moving, dammit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning around to him) Will you shut up for a minute!! (to Catherine) Pull your car out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you let me talk to you, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. I haven't been being fair to Carl. I have to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Oh. You have to tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I can't hear you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at her not responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry everything's been so confusing, but I have to go, Robert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'll see you later this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls ahead and moves onto the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a friend of Carl's. (Somewhere under the following, the ANGLE ALTERS to include TWO OTHER FRIENDS, as well as Carl, Catherine, Bobby and Rayette, seated around the living room, variously captive to her monologue.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the point is, man is born into the world with a pre-existent adversary, both real and imaginary, so you'd have to say that aggression was one of his primary, psychic inheritances, which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN FINCHER, a professorial type, attempts to interject:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may beg to differ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg all you like, John, but the fact remains that man takes enormous delight in aggressive acts, as well as the portrayal of aggressive acts, and to be triumphant over another no matter how, seems fundamental to his having a sense of well being, as well as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't quarrel with your inference, but you draw too long a bow in your conclusions, which seem unnecessarily harsh and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't make poetry. As an analyst, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette interrupts, calling across the room to Carl:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a TV in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts to answer and is pre-empted by Samia:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John believes in the basic goodness of man, and that's fine, but gaze into the pit like I have and that view seems a little soporific. And not unlike television, it hardly represents the real world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some good things on it, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV. There's some good things on it, sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I strongly doubt it, but I wasn't really discussing media...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really hold such bleak views, how can you, in good conscience, carry on a practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's always hope, I think, for a few individuals, if they're courageous enough to shed their illusions and their...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) And what about love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it? Wouldn't you agree that a great deal of mischief has been done in the name of love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a romantic, Catherine, as are most musicians, and what's more, about to be married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and his reaction as Samia goes on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... which should exclude you from any objective discussion. But keep in mind, even the arts aren't free of aggressive content, nor the institution of marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think these cold, "objective" discussions are aggressive, Samia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and starts to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd like to say, so that I don't dampen the spirit of your adventure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) You haven't dampened my spirit, Samia... Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I should hope not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room, with Bobby's eyes following her, and as Carl moves over to sit beside Rayette, Samia resumes to Fincher while the other friend moves in beside Bobby and tries to engage him in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because obviously there are loftier classes of people that do establish a kind of relating, that's relatively free of... (Etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she indicates Tita's dog, lying near the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of doggy is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Borzoi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh huh. I had a little kittycat once, that Bobby give me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calls across to Bobby, interrupting Samia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Bobby?! The little pussycat you gave me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, now feeling trapped by the other friend, looks across to her ass she returns her attention to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had four little white paws, an' oh, was I crazy over her. We hadda go an' leave her one time at some friends, an' she went out an' got smashed flatter'n a tortilla right outside their mobile home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samia gestures toward Rayette as if she were an example to prove her point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. You see what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks over at Samia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choice of words, "squashed flat," juxtaposed against the image of a fluffy kitten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She addresses Fincher gesturing toward Rayette again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you see how close that is to what I'm trying to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands up, cutting her off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sit there pointing at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing on her) I said, don't point at her like that! What gives you the right to sit there and tell anybody about class and who the hell's got it, and what she typifies! You shouldn't even be in the same room with her, you creep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, this is really too much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Samia) You're totally full of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, I think you better just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) You're all full of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running up the stairs and down the hall to Catherine's room. He goes inside and, not finding her, comes quickly back into the hall. As he moves down it, opening other doors, he begins calling her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes back down the stairs and runs into Rayette at the bottom landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving past her) I can't talk to you right now, leave me alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the music room, to the den, then down the main hall to the kitchen, which gives off to two other doors. He opens one of them, to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita and Spicer. Though both are clothed, they are caught in some stage of intimacy on top of Spicer's bed. Tita sits up immediately, mortally embarrassed, as Bobby steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita, what the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving over to the bed) What's going on here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of your business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Catherine?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where she is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer moves to Bobby, taking hold of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you believe in knocking, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby roughly pushes him away and advances on Tita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to you, Tita!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to tears) Can't I have anything to myself,  dammit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing hold of him again) Come on now, out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling with him) Keep your fucking hands off my sister, nurse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer goes into sudden rage, pushing Bobby violently toward the door and yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me! Move out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leaps at him and as their struggle carries them into the kitchen, Tita begins yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Bobby, will just you stop! I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicer gets Bobby into a painful headlock and is being bulled around the kitchen by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, just hold it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crash into the kitchen table, knocking chairs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl! Somebody get Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby rams Spicer into the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls him against the kitchen wall, still holding him in a headlock as Tita enters the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Right now! Just stop it!! Carl!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she runs from the room, Spicer begins violently jerking his forearm up against Bobby's trachea, punctuating each jerk with the repeated command:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up! Give up! Give up! Give up! Give up! Give up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels Bobby's body slacken. He releases him and Bobby drops to the floor as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Carl, Catherine and Tita run into the kitchen, looking to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, gasping for air, tries to get up from the floor, and unable to, slumps back against the kitchen wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Bobby, look what you've done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks past her, to Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to talk to you for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Bobby sit on a low stone wall bordering the Dupea property. Each is staring out at the ocean, and after a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's useless, Robert. It wouldn't work, not ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a chance, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to be delicate with you, but you're not understanding me. It's not just because of Carl, or my music, but because of you... (she looks at him) I mean, what would it come to? If a person has no love for himself, no respect, no love for his work, his family, his friends, something... How can he ask for love in return? I mean, why should he ask for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Profoundly wounded, he looks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And living out here, in this rest home asylum, that's what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back to her) That'll make you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it will, yes. (she pauses, then:) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needing to distance herself from witnessing his pain, she gets up and moves OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes move from her to look out over the bay and, after a brief silence, he softly utters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pushes Nicholas's wheelchair along a path between fields of tall grasses and wildflowers. He stops and moves around to the front of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over to adjust the blanket covering Nicholas's legs and, hunkering down in front of him, glances around at the fields, searching for articulation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you'd be particularly interested in hearing anything about me. My life, I mean... Most of it doesn't add up to much... that I could relate as a way of life that you'd approve of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses briefly, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to be able to tell you why, but I don't really... I mean, I move around a lot because things tend to get bad when I stay. And I'm looking... for auspicious beginnings, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off again, resuming with evident difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to, you know, imagine your half of this conversation... My feeling is, that if you could talk, we probably wouldn't be talking. That's pretty much how it got to be before. I left... (another pause) Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches his father's face, entreating him for some kind of answer, some sign of response, and seeing none...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he breaks down, barely able to utter the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tita suggested that we try to... I don't know. I think that she... seems to feel we've got... some understanding to reach... She totally denies the fact that we were never that comfortable with each other to begin with... (pauses, trying to gain control) The best I can do, is apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks silently at his father for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know I was never really that good at it, anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then, bowing bis head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby comes out the front door. He carries his suitcase and, as he descends the steps and moves across the drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Tita, wearing gloves and holding a pair of gardening clippers, comes around the side of the house and calls out to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets the suitcase down as she comes toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I said a week, and I've overstayed myself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going without saying goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to say goodbye to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at her) I'll say goodbye to you, Tita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her arms around him and as she embraces him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once in a while, call and tell me where you are, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the birdie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette, standing near the open trunk of Bobby's car, taking a Polaroid shot of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby returns his attention to Tita, kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) Bye, Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his suitcase and moves to the trunk, where Rayette is fussing with her camera. He puts the suitcase inside, closes the trunk and takes hold of her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resisting him) Wait a sec. I want Tita to take a picture of you an' me in front of the place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls free of him and, as she moves back toward Tita, Bobby can be seen getting into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got the chance to thank you all for your hospitality. You tell Carl for me, if any of you folks wanta come on down to our place anytime, you'd be more'n welcome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, that's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye bye, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves back to the car and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching as Bobby's car pulls out of the drive and disappears onto the private road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bobby's car moves over a highway through the northern forests, RAYETTE'S VOICE is heard SINGING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Your kiss is like a drink when I'm thirsty/An' I'm thirsty for you with all my heart..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette is seated close to Bobby, looking at him as she sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "But don't love me/Then act as though we've never kissed/Oh, don't touch me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans closer and kisses him, then bringing her lips close to his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't touch me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't touch me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't touch me..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her kisses become more fervent and insistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, don't touch..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grievously hurt by his gesture and expressive of an anger she's heretofore been afraid to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch, Bobby! You quit pushin' me away like that! I've had enough a that to last me a lifetime!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a fist of her hand as though she were about to hit him, then changes her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whyn't you just try an' be good to me for a change!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response. She turns away from him, looking out through the windshield for a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There id'n anyone gonna look after you an' love you better'n I do, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby? Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it turns off the highway and pulls up into a gas station next to roadside cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: searching through her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go in that cafe an' get some coffee. You want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches into his jacket, takes out his wallet and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you just have 50 cents or somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, be right back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby gets out of the car as the station attendant approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette turns back to him as she nears the front of the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to attendant) Fill it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant moves to the pumps, and as Bobby crosses toward the men's room and disappears inside, a Peterbilt semi can be seen pulling into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby removes his jacket and lays it on top of the waste container. He moves to the wash basin and stands a moment, gazing absently down at it, his mind searching for that inward oblivion in which nothing much is demanded, nothing much felt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, leaning over and placing his hands on the rim of the basin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he lifts his gaze to the mirror and, after minutely perusing the features of his face, looks into his own eyes as he had into his fathers, silently beseeching them for guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOUND OF SEMI'S MOTOR OVER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REMOTE ANGLE as Bobby comes out of the men's room. He has left his jacket inside and stands for a moment, looking at the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... DRIVER, bending down to check the undercarriage of the semi. As he stands up and circuits the front of the truck, heading for the cab:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly audible) Hey, wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over to him and after a brief exchange, the driver nods his bead and continues on to the cab, Bobby moves to the passenger door and climbs up into the pass seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver glances over at Bobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you got a jacket or anything with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't, I uh... it got burned up. Everything in the car got the shit burned out of it. All I got left is what I have on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an extra jacket behind the seat, if you want to put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. But I'll tell you, where we're headed is gonna get colder'n hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver puts the truck into gear and releases the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the truck begins to move forward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The semi pulls out of the station onto the highway, giving view to Bobby's car. The attendant is cleaning the windshield and Rayette can be seen opening the passenger door. As she gets out and surveys the area for some sign of Bobby, the semi MOVES INTO VIEW, going north on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayette looks over the hood of the car, addressing the attendant. He gestures toward the men's room and as she moves across the station and disappears OFF THE SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the semi recedes in the distance, leaving a black trail of smoke from its exhaust stack, dissipating in the air.
